roles.name: Content Producer
roles.description: Oversees content creation from scripting to final delivery, coordinating teams (writers, camera, editors) to produce shows, documentaries, or news segments.

meta.typicalBackground: Broadcasting, journalism, or film production, strong project management, creative vision
challenges: Budget constraints, tight deadlines, balancing editorial standards with audience appeal

sampleUseCase.scenario: A producer spearheads a mini-series on climate solutions, assembling experts, hosting field shoots, and delivering episodes across multiple digital channels.

roles.name: Broadcast Engineer
roles.description: Maintains and optimizes technical systems for radio/TV stations, ensuring signal quality and minimal downtime.

meta.typicalBackground: Electronics or broadcast engineering, knowledge of transmission protocols (IP-based or traditional)
keyTools: Audio consoles, satellite uplinks, RF spectrum analyzers
challenges: Equipment failures, compliance with broadcast standards (SMPTE, ATSC), bridging legacy infrastructure with digital systems

sampleUseCase.scenario: A broadcast engineer migrates a TV station from SDI cabling to an IP-based system, improving flexibility for remote production and reducing overall maintenance costs.

roles.name: Social Media Manager
roles.description: Curates and schedules content for media brand’s social channels, engaging audiences, driving traffic, and analyzing campaign success.

meta.typicalBackground: Marketing or communications, strong writing skills, knowledge of social media algorithms
challenges: Algorithm changes, crisis response to negative feedback, short content life-cycle in fast feeds

sampleUseCase.scenario: The manager launches a hashtag challenge for a new show, generating user-generated content that trends locally and boosts channel subscriptions.

roles.name: Investigative Journalist
roles.description: Researches and uncovers in-depth stories on public interest issues, analyzing documents, interviewing sources, and presenting findings with integrity.

meta.typicalBackground: Journalism or communication degree, investigative methods, strong ethics, legal awareness (libel, FOIA)
keyTools: Data analysis for large document sets
challenges: Threat of legal action, hidden or resistant sources, verifying authenticity of leaked documents

sampleUseCase.scenario: An investigative journalist exposes financial irregularities in a local government contract by analyzing procurement data and interviewing whistleblowers, prompting official inquiries.

roles.name: Media Planner
roles.description: Develops and implements advertising and content distribution strategies, selecting channels and schedules to maximize reach or ROI.

meta.typicalBackground: Advertising or marketing background, data-driven approach to media buying
challenges: Fragmented audiences across digital platforms, rising ad costs, ensuring brand alignment

sampleUseCase.scenario: A media planner allocates a beverage brand’s ad spend across prime-time TV, YouTube pre-roll, and sponsored social posts, optimizing for each platform’s demographic insights.
